data.title: About: Eyewitness (British TV series)
data.meta_description: Eyewitness is a British nature and science television series produced by the BBC and DK Vision. The series is based on the bestselling series of Eyewitness Books by Dorling Kindersley, which still continues to this day. Guy Michelmore composed the series` opening and ending themes, as well as the score for each individual episode of Season 1, with Guy Dagul writing the score for each individual episode of Seasons 2 and 3, respectively. Dagul`s scores for season 3 also incorporated stock music tracks and cues by Dick DeBenedictis.
data.text:
dbo:Work/runtime

30.0

dbo:abstract

Eyewitness is a British nature and science television series produced by the BBC and DK Vision. The series is based on the bestselling series of Eyewitness Books by Dorling Kindersley, which still continues to this day. Guy Michelmore composed the series` opening and ending themes, as well as the score for each individual episode of Season 1, with Guy Dagul writing the score for each individual episode of Seasons 2 and 3, respectively. Dagul`s scores for season 3 also incorporated stock music tracks and cues by Dick DeBenedictis. (en)

Les Yeux de la découverte (Eyewitness) est une série télévisée documentaire britannique en 39 épisodes de 28 minutes, produite par la BBC, d'après une série de livres du même nom publiée chez Gallimard Jeunesse. Elle est diffusée en France à partir de 1995 sur La Cinquième. (fr)

dbp:shortsummary

Discusses natural disasters-earthquakes, volcanoes, tsunamis, floods, hurricanes, tornadoes, blizzards, avalanches, drought, wildfires, and asteroid impacts. (en)

Discusses sharks and their relatives, rays and skates. (en)

Discusses amphibians. (en)

Discusses bears. (en)

Discusses biology. (en)

Discusses birds. (en)

Discusses both mythical and real-life monsters. (en)

Discusses butterflies and moths. (en)

Discusses dinosaurs. (en)

Discusses elephants. (en)

Discusses fish. (en)

Discusses geology. (en)

Discusses horses and their wild relatives. (en)

Discusses insects. (en)

Discusses islands. (en)

Discusses mammals. (en)

Discusses mountains. (en)

Discusses non-human primates. (en)

Discusses oceans. (en)

Discusses plants. (en)

Discusses rainforests. (en)

Discusses reptiles. (en)

Discusses rivers and ponds. (en)

Discusses shells. (en)

Discusses the Earth`s polar regions. (en)

Discusses the human body. (en)

Discusses the intertidal zone. (en)

Discusses the world of vision. (en)

Discusses trees. (en)

Discusses volcanoes and earthquakes. (en)

Discusses weather. (en)

Discusses dogs and their wild relatives and ancestors. (en)

Discusses how animals survive in the natural world. (en)

Discusses the planets and other objects in our Solar System, as well as their study and exploration, past present, and future. (en)

Discusses the skeletal system and how it varies in different species, including humans. (en)

Discusses the origin and evolution of life on Earth, from the earliest microbes to the appearance of modern humans. (en)
